arm_group.description: Participants will receive intranasal oxytocin 40 International Units (IU) twice daily for two weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
This will be a pilot feasibility study assessing the tolerability of chronic administration
      of intranasal oxytocin to patients receiving methadone at an opioid replacement clinic who
      are actively using cocaine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Enrolled as a patient in the San Francisco General Hospital Opioid Treatment
             Outpatient Program

          -  Stable dose of methadone for at least the past two weeks

          -  At least one routine urine toxicology screen positive for cocaine in the past month

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Positive urine pregnancy test

          -  Use of illicit drugs in the past month (with the exception of cocaine)

          -  Currently meets Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-5 (DSM-V) criteria for severe major
             depressive disorder with suicidal thoughts or actions

          -  History of psychotic or moderate-severe alcohol use disorder as defined by DSM-V
             criteria

          -  Severe neuropsychological disorder, brain trauma, epilepsy

          -  Sensitivity to preservatives (in particular E 216, E 218 and chlorobutanol
             hemihydrate)

          -  Nasal obstruction, discharge, or bleeding

          -  Habitually drinks large volumes of water

          -  Taking antipsychotics or mood stabilizers, testosterone or estrogen/progesterone
             supplement, or serotonin-1a receptor agonists/antagonists

facility.name: San Francisco General Hospital Opiate Treatment Outpatient Program

clinical_study.official_title: Tolerability and Feasibility Study of Chronic Intranasal Oxytocin as an Adjunct to Methadone Maintenance Treatment in Patients With Co-occuring Opioid Use Disorder and Cocaine Use: A Two Week Pilot Study

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with non-serious and serious adverse events

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
